channel.title: "Best" Open Source Server
channel.description: Hi guys, I'd love to get start learning how to make private servers, and I was wondering what everyones opinion is on the server with the best code is. I mean best in terms of clean code, rather than how feature complete it is. Thanks for any help!

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @Nathan_R Nathan R
item.description:
@Nathan_R wrote:

hyperion

Read full topic

You’ve never seen mine.[/quote]He mentioned ones for download, I don’t see yours in the download section…so… <3

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:18, topic:425731”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=528395.msg3853344#msg3853344 date=1324184123]
I feel that saying anything after this will bring nothing but an infraction. But one last thing,
you said PI is clean and nice?

No, its not.
[/quote]

I’m guessing this is the combat deadlock they were talking about a while back. There should be a ton of tutorials on how to fix this by now…[/quote]
This is the original, not touched, I am just simply stating that a base with this many bugs could not be handled by one so new, and he really should just learn real java first.

Read full topic

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:425731”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=528395.msg3853317#msg3853317 date=1324183229]

Use Project Insanity or a variation of it.
[/quote]he said clean code lol you can’t list a single one that is clean.

It’s his first time posting and he says he has just starting coding and you expect him to be able to manage Hyperion? Project Insanity is fine, it will help him learn. Once he gets the fundamentals down he can make his own frame or use Hyperion. Don’t leave smart-ass replies, leave helpful ones.

This is a learning community. We do not spoonfeed etc. This means, a person should join knowing that learning a language of some kind will be required. He also mentioned a clean one. There is nothing “smart ass” about suggesting a base that is actually that, clean. if you actually continue to read and comprehend java/other language tutorials you can do a lot with a clean base.

Is there anything wrong with a PI?

Not at all, i 100% believe in the saying that :

a server is made by the programmer

Meaning, it is THEIR choice if they wish to make PI good or not. All Tyb and I were doing was simply answering the “clean” part. Now let’s get back to your comment about “contributions” well guess what, I don’t see you linking him/her to a java/other language tutorial to start his new “adventure”[/quote]

It’s funny how you contradicted yourself there. In a single post you said how I should link him to a tutorial and not spoodfeed him. Project Insanity is perfectly clean and easy to run/manage. Stop circlejerking the elitists who tell you Hyperion is the best for beginners, its not.

[quote=“tyb97, post:13, topic:425731”]Project Insanity is with java, its just written poorly, Hyperion is java to, I just assume your to ignorant to open one, because you think that programming is base dependent, and its not, if you would learn to get off you ass and try something one day, and go download a Hyperion, you would see that Graham has comment a shitton of stuff, and it is very easy to learn from.

@OP: I would learn real java first, doing something like PI will teach you bad habits, don’t listen to shit heads that tell you other wise.[/quote]

I have been working with java since 2007, its pleasing to see you tell me I don’t know anything. I have downloaded and looked at Hyperion and agree it is much better then Project Insanity, but it’s content is not as “full” as Project Insanity. I learned how to program using Allstar-scape. The base means nothing, it’s what you do with it.

Read full topic

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:10, topic:425731”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=528395.msg3853311#msg3853311 date=1324183072]

Use Project Insanity or a variation of it.
[/quote]he said clean code lol you can’t list a single one that is clean.

It’s his first time posting and he says he has just starting coding and you expect him to be able to manage Hyperion? Project Insanity is fine, it will help him learn. Once he gets the fundamentals down he can make his own frame or use Hyperion. Don’t leave smart-ass replies, leave helpful ones.[/quote]

This is a learning community. We do not spoonfeed etc. This means, a person should join knowing that learning a language of some kind will be required. He also mentioned a clean one. There is nothing “smart ass” about suggesting a base that is actually that, clean. if you actually continue to read and comprehend java/other language tutorials you can do a lot with a clean base.

Is there anything wrong with a PI?

Not at all, i 100% believe in the saying that :

a server is made by the programmer

Meaning, it is THEIR choice if they wish to make PI good or not. All Tyb and I were doing was simply answering the “clean” part. Now let’s get back to your comment about “contributions” well guess what, I don’t see you linking him/her to a java/other language tutorial to start his new “adventure”

Read full topic

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Project Insanity is with java, its just written poorly, Hyperion is java to, I just assume your to ignorant to open one, because you think that programming is base dependent, and its not, if you would learn to get off you ass and try something one day, and go download a Hyperion, you would see that Graham has comment a shitton of stuff, and it is very easy to learn from.

@OP: I would learn real java first, doing something like PI will teach you bad habits, don’t listen to shit heads that tell you other wise.

item.title: "Best" Open Source Server
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:11, topic:425731”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=528395.msg3853307#msg3853307 date=1324182998]
Use Project Insanity or a variation of it.
[/quote]
He said one with good code, not piles of shit.

And you can program Hyperion, it will teach you the right way, and on one fucking cares if you help him? You say you can program “pi” when its not even a language, if you knew real java you could program any server.

And don’t be like me who started with PI, a horrible choice.[/quote]

Project Insanity isn’t piles of shit. You can’t call it that if you can’t make anything better. He obviously doesn’t know java so he is posting. So again, the obvious answer is: Project Insanity.

Read full topic
